name: Chihuahua
metaDescription: Chihuahuas face dental disease, knee problems, and heart issues. Compare the best pet insurance for Chihuahuas—coverage for luxating patella, dental & more.
intro: Chihuahuas are the smallest dog breed but can have big health bills. Dental disease, knee problems, and heart conditions are common. Their tiny size also makes them vulnerable to injuries from falls or accidents.
whyInsurance: Chihuahuas are prone to luxating patella (knee surgery can cost $3,500), heart disease, and severe dental problems. Their long lifespan (14-18 years) means more time for issues to develop.

costIntro: Chihuahuas are among the cheapest breeds to insure. Here's what to expect:

faqs.question: Are Chihuahuas expensive to insure?
faqs.answer: No, Chihuahuas are among the cheapest breeds to insure—typically $25-50/month. Their small size means lower surgery costs, though dental and heart issues can still be expensive.

faqs.question: Why do Chihuahuas have dental problems?
faqs.answer: Their tiny jaws can't accommodate all their teeth properly, leading to severe crowding, decay, and gum disease. Many Chihuahuas need teeth extracted. Look for insurance covering dental illness.

faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Chihuahua?
faqs.answer: Yes. Despite low premiums, Chihuahuas commonly need knee surgery ($3,000+), heart treatment, and dental work. Their long lifespan (14-18 years) means more opportunity for issues.

faqs.question: What is luxating patella?
faqs.answer: A condition where the kneecap slides out of place, causing pain and lameness. It's very common in Chihuahuas and other toy breeds. Surgery costs $1,500-$3,500 per knee.

faqs.question: Do Chihuahuas have heart problems?
faqs.answer: Yes, Chihuahuas are prone to mitral valve disease, a progressive heart condition. It's manageable with medication but can require expensive treatment. Insurance with heart coverage is important.
